Master Answer:
If you are now a resident of BC, you and your family can receive publicly funded (free) vaccines that you meet the eligibility criteria for. As you do not yet have MSP coverage, book immunizations at your local health unit.  Publicly funded vaccines are also available from some pharmacies and doctors' offices. However, you may be charged a vaccine administration fee in these settings without MSP. You can find a flu clinic near you with our Influenza (Flu) Clinic finder.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: I have recently moved to BC with my spouse and 3 year old son. Is BC provincial health Insurance coverage requires to get a flu vaccine shot at a BC public health clinic?
